pullRequest.body:
Define `SimplexCategoryGenRel` as the category presented by generators and relation by the following data:
  - Objects are natural numbers. The constructor is `SimplexCategoryGenRel.mk`.
  - Morphisms are generated by two classes of morphisms : `Î´ {n : â„•} (i : Fin (n + 2)) : mk n âŸ¶ mk (n + 1)` and `Ïƒ {n : â„•} (i : Fin (n + 1)) : mk (n + 1) âŸ¶ mk n`
  - Morphisms are subject to the simplicial relations, i.e the relations proven for `SimplexCategory` in `AlgebraicTopology/SimplexCategory.lean`

We provide induction principles for objects and morphisms for this category, and construct a canonical functor to `SimplexCategory`.

Part of a series of PR formalising that `SimplexCategoryGenRel` is equivalent to `SimplexCategory`.

---

-->

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Apart from some little syntax improvements, this looks good to me!

```suggestion
We introduce `SimplexCategoryGenRel` as the category presented by generating
```

```suggestion
/-- A morphism in `FreeSimplexQuiver` is either a face map (`Î´`) or a degeneracy map (`Ïƒ`). -/
```
Instead of `simplicial1`, etc, the names of the constructors could be parallel to the corresponding lemmas like `Î´_comp_Î´`, etc.

This may be slightly better:
```suggestion
lemma morphismProperty_eq_top (P : MorphismProperty SimplexCategoryGenRel)
```

I think `rec` is the standard name for these:
```suggestion
protected def rec {P : SimplexCategoryGenRel â†’ Sort*}
```

In other categories, we typically have `hom_ext` and `ext`:
```suggestion
lemma ext {x y : SimplexCategoryGenRel} (h : x.len = y.len) : x = y := by
```
It seems this is `SimplexCategory.SimplexCategoryGenRel`. I would think `SimplexCategoryGenRel` would be better.

The coercion from `â„•` to `Fin` does not have good definitional properties. It would be easier to avoid it. If you absolutely need a version with natural numbers, I think it should be phrased as:
```suggestion
/-- A version of Î´_comp_Î´ with indices in `â„•` satisfying relevant inequalities. -/
lemma Î´_comp_Î´_nat {n} (i j : â„•) (hi : i < n + 2) (hj : j < n + 2) (H : i â‰¤ j) :
    Î´ âŸ¨i, hiâŸ© â‰« Î´ âŸ¨j + 1, by omegaâŸ© = Î´ âŸ¨j, hjâŸ© â‰« Î´ âŸ¨i, by omegaâŸ© :=
  Î´_comp_Î´ (n := n) (i := âŸ¨i, by omegaâŸ©) (j := âŸ¨j, by omegaâŸ©) (by simpa)
```

```suggestion
def toSimplexCategory : SimplexCategoryGenRel â¥¤ SimplexCategory :=
  CategoryTheory.Quotient.lift _
    (Paths.lift
      { obj := .mk
        map f := match f with
          | FreeSimplexQuiver.Hom.Î´ i => SimplexCategory.Î´ i
          | FreeSimplexQuiver.Hom.Ïƒ i => SimplexCategory.Ïƒ i })
    (fun _ _ _ _ h â†¦ by
      cases h with
      | simplicial1 H => exact SimplexCategory.Î´_comp_Î´ H
      | simplicial2 H => exact SimplexCategory.Î´_comp_Ïƒ_of_le H
      | simplicial3â‚ => exact SimplexCategory.Î´_comp_Ïƒ_self
      | simplicial3â‚‚ => exact SimplexCategory.Î´_comp_Ïƒ_succ
      | simplicial4 H => exact SimplexCategory.Î´_comp_Ïƒ_of_gt H
      | simplicial5 H => exact SimplexCategory.Ïƒ_comp_Ïƒ H)
```

`SimplexCategory` is in the root namespace.
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
instance quiv : Quiver FreeSimplexQuiver where
```

Untested, but it the above works, this one should also:
```suggestion
    (SimplexCategoryGenRel.mk (n + 1)) âŸ¶ .mk n :=
```
Looks like I can in fact remove `SimplexCategoryGenRel` on both sides.

If the statement can fit into one line, this is preferred:
```suggestion
lemma toSimplexCategory_map_Î´ {n : â„•} (i : Fin (n + 2)) :
    toSimplexCategory.map (Î´ i) = SimplexCategory.Î´ i := rfl
```
Same below.

Not a great improvement, but this is one line less:
```suggestion
    (fun _ _ _ _ h â†¦ match h with 
      | .Î´_comp_Î´ H => SimplexCategory.Î´_comp_Î´ H
      | .Î´_comp_Ïƒ_of_le H => SimplexCategory.Î´_comp_Ïƒ_of_le H
      | .Î´_comp_Ïƒ_self => SimplexCategory.Î´_comp_Ïƒ_self
      | .Î´_comp_Ïƒ_succ => SimplexCategory.Î´_comp_Ïƒ_succ
      | .Î´_comp_Ïƒ_of_gt H => SimplexCategory.Î´_comp_Ïƒ_of_gt H
      | .Ïƒ_comp_Ïƒ H => SimplexCategory.Ïƒ_comp_Ïƒ H)
```

**[lint-style (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (fun _ _ _ _ h â†¦ match h with ```
bot fix style

The proofs are neat, but I think this could also benefit from the API I suggest in #21743: for any `W : MorphismProperty C`, there is a multiplicative morphism property generated by `W`, and various ways (including induction principles) to characterize it.
I'll try implementing this then!
(This new API could go in the file `MorphismProperty.Composition`, in a separate PR.)
I ended up leaving the statement for `hom_induction` and `hom_induction'`as they were since itâ€™s useful to have them in "unrolled" form, but their proof now relies on the content of #21864
